newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end marginally lower on profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end marginally lower on profit taking.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended slightly lower on Wednesday after profit taking eroded early additions to the previous day's gains, brokers said. But they said the losses were cushioned by small-lot buying by investors and some pubic funds.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 finished 32.74 points, or 0.15 percent lower at 21,397.19. Its December futures fell 60 points to 21,430.
"It's natural that profit-taking emerged after the sudden rise on Tuesday of more than 400 points," a broker at a medium-sized brokerage said.
Kyocera added 80 yen to close at 7,920 yen after the ceramic maker said it plans to change its stock trading unit to 100 shares from 1,000 shares on February 3, 1997.

In the over-the-counter (OTC) market, semiconductor trading firm Vitec Co Ltd ended at 140 yen lower at 1,000 yen on reports that Japan's securities watchdog has begun investigating whether a senior executive had carried out insider trading.
The OTC index closed up 4.44 points or 0.29 percent at 1,531.79.
